title: Data
text:
The data used in this compilation was obtained from a number of sources including online services and by directly contacting Provincial and Territorial departments responsible for data management. Because some of the coverage data are not available for the public, the vector layers presented on this website cannot be shared.
The table below lists the sources of coverage data by jurisdiction. Note that “Last update” corresponds to the date the coverage map for each jurisdiction was updated, and is not indicative of the most recent ALS acquisition.

title: Data
text:
ALS data availability





Jurisdiction
Data sharing policy




BC
ALS - open data.DEM and CHM from systematic provincial acquisition will be shared. www.lidar.gov.bc.ca


AB
GoA: Initial provincial coverage ALS data and derivatives were acquired with a licence (i.e., data were leased for 99 years). Sharing is limited to GoA partners (e.g. academia) for collaborative projects and forest industry. Industry: 11 projects between 2017 and 2022 funded through the Forest Resource Improvement Program (FRIP). Data are not currently open, although FRIP is public funds. ABMI acquisitions will be made freely available.


SK
ALS point clouds currently not shared as open data.Derivatives (DEM) are shared openly (not all derived from lidar): environment-saskatchewan.hub.arcgis.com


ON
ALS point clouds and derivatives (DEM, CHM, DSM) are open data, available at geohub.lio.gov.on.ca


QC
ALS data available for purchase (geoboutique.mern.gouv.qc.ca).Derivatives (DEM, CHM, hillshade, slope) available as open data: https://www.donneesquebec.ca/


NB
ALS data are open and available for download: www.snb.ca/geonb1/e/dc/lidar.asp.Derivatives (i.e. DEM, CHM, hillshade, slope) are open and are available as WMS/WCS service.


PE
ALS data available for download: download-telecharger.services.geo.ca


NS
ALS files and derivatives are open data (nsgi.novascotia.ca/datalocator/elevation/).

title: Data
text:
Additional ALS datasets in Canada
ALS data acquired outside of forest ecosystems (e.g., in urban areas or for flood mapping purposes) or for research purposes are not included in the maps and summaries above. Some of those datasets include:

High Resolution Digital Elevation Model (HRDEM) - CanElevation Series
High Resolution Digital Elevation Model Mosaic (HRDEM Mosaic) CanElevation Series
National Elevation Data Strategy
LiDAR Point Clouds - CanElevation Series
Petawawa Research Forest

title: Contact
text:
We welcome your feedback!
If you find errors or know of data that should be added to the maps please let us know. You can submit an issue or contact us directly at
Piotr Tompalski: piotr.tompalski@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca
Joanne White: joanne.white@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca

title: ALS data coverage in Canadian forests
text:
This webpage is designed to present the current status of airborne laser scanning (ALS) data coverage across Canada’s forested landscapes. We present a collection of maps and descriptive statistics that illustrate the current status and availability of ALS data, specifically focusing on its applications within forestry. ALS acquisitions outside Canada’s forested ecozones (e.g. in urban areas) or data acquired for research projects are not included.
This webpage accompanies the publication by White et al. 2025, and is designed to keep the statistics and maps presented in the paper up to date.








White, J.C., Tompalski, P., Bater, C.W., Wulder, M.A., Fortin, M., Hennigar, C., Robere-McGugan, G., Sinclair, I., White, R. (2025). Enhanced forest inventories in Canada: implementation, status, and research needs. Canadian Journal of Forest Research, 55: 1–37. doi.org/10.1139/cjfr-2024-0255.







Information on this website is periodically updated to ensure the most current and accurate representation of ALS data coverage. See ALS coverage data sources to find the date the coverage was updated for each jurisdiction.

Most recent coverage summary







Total ALS Coverage
1.98M km²
21.7% of total land area of Canada.









Coverage of forested ecozones
30.3%









Coverage of managed forests
71.9%








The total area of ALS coverage in Canada is currently 1,977,547 km2, which corresponds to approximately 21.7% of the total land area of the country. The coverage of all forested ecozones is approximately 30.3%, while the coverage of managed forests is approximately 71.9%.

An area of 388088.3 km2 has been surveyed more than once using ALS, providing multitemporal coverage that represents about 8.5% of Canada’s land area and 13.9% of managed forests.


Maps
The map showing the overall ALS coverage is presented below. Additional maps show acquisition year, point cloud density, and areas of multiple overlapping acquisitions. More detailed maps are available for western and eastern parts of the country.



Acquisitions over time
